title: StreamFlow: Streaming Flow Matching with Block-wise Guided Attention Mask for Speech Token Decoding
author: Dake Guo (Northwestern Polytechnical University), Jixun Yao (Northwestern Polytechnical University), Linhan Ma (Northwestern Polytechnical University), Wang He (Northwestern Polytechnical University), Lei Xie (Northwestern Polytechnical University), ...
relevance_why: The proposed method addresses real-time speech generation efficiently, which is relevant to Haohe Liu's research in speech synthesis and restoration. The focus on streaming generation aligns with the needs for low-latency applications in audio processing.
background: Streaming speech synthesis: generating speech tokens in real-time using an efficient framework that maintains high audio quality.
contribution: This paper introduces StreamFlow, a streaming flow matching model that utilizes block-wise guided attention masks to enhance the efficiency of speech token decoding, achieving a low first-packet latency of 180ms.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods struggled with generating high-quality speech in real-time due to their reliance on a global receptive field, leading to delays.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by segmenting the input into blocks and applying hierarchical attention masks to balance the receptive fields, allowing for smooth and efficient streaming of audio.

key_innovation: The use of block-wise guided attention masks effectively captures local information while allowing for contextual consistency across chunks during streaming synthesis.
real_world_impact: By achieving high-quality audio generation with low latency, this method has strong potential for improving interactive speech applications like virtual assistants and conversational agents.
limitations: No explicit limitations mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.block-wise attention masks: **Block-wise attention masks** are mechanisms that control which parts of the input can influence each other during processing, allowing localized information exchange while maintaining a structured flow.
new_terms.streaming flow matching: **Streaming flow matching** refers to the process of generating audio in real-time by matching incoming speech tokens to a desired audio output within a efficient framework.

open_sourcing: Speech samples are available at https://dukguo.github.io/StreamFlow/
